intro: Monoxora, commonly known as the grass-of-Parnassus, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Iridaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to southern Africa. The plants are characterized by their tall, erect stems and showy, often blue or violet-colored flowers. They typically grow in rocky or sandy soils and are adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. Monoxora species are often cultivated for their ornamental value due to their striking floral displays.
